channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'He is here with us' - Macclesfield make FA Cup history on emotional day
item.description: Non-league Macclesfield made FA Cup history by knocking out holders Crystal Palace on a memorable but emotional day - their victory achieved against a backdrop of tragedy.

item.title: 'Humble' Semenyo steals show in FA Cup mauling
item.description: Antoine Semenyo signed off at Bournemouth in fairytale fashion and makes start to life at Manchester City in a similarly dreamy manner during 10-1 FA Cup win over League One Exeter City.

item.title: Is Macclesfield beating Crystal Palace greatest FA Cup upset?
item.description: After Macclesfield beat FA Cup holders Crystal Palace in the third round, BBC Sport looks at 10 of the biggest upsets in the competition's history.

item.title: Non-league Macclesfield stun FA Cup holders Crystal Palace
item.description: Sixth-tier Macclesfield FC beat reigning champions Crystal Palace. With 117 places between the teams, it's the biggest upset in FA Cup history.

item.title: Roefs the hero as Sunderland beat Everton on penalties
item.description: Robin Roefs saves three out of three penalties as Sunderland knocked out Everton in the third round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Macclesfield fans invade the pitch after beating Palace
item.description: The Macclesfield fans invade the pitch after beating last season's FA Cup winners Crystal Palace, in the biggest upset in FA Cup history.

item.title: Strand Larsen scores hat-trick as Wolves thrash Shrewsbury
item.description: Striker Jorgen Strand Larsen's hat-trick ends his Wolves goal drought as he fires them past League Two Shrewsbury into the FA Cup fourth round.

item.title: Barnes brace helps Burnley to victory over Millwall
item.description: Premier League strugglers Burnley score three first-half goals as they sweep aside Championship team Millwall to reach the fourth round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Supersub Wilson sparks Fulham comeback against Middlesbrough
item.description: Harry Wilson came on to help his side avoid a potential upset, as Fulham score three second half goals to beat Middlesbrough.

item.title: Brentford form continues with FA Cup victory over Sheffield Wednesday
item.description: Brentford continue their excellent season by cruising past Championship strugglers Sheffield Wednesday to reach the FA Cup fourth round.

item.title: Philogene & Greaves goals take Ipswich past Blackpool
item.description: Jaden Philogene's exquisite first-half strike helps Championship promotion hopefuls Ipswich Town to victory over League One side Blackpool in the FA Cup third round.

item.title: Comfortable away win for Burton Albion against Boreham Wood
item.description: Kain Adom is instrumental on his Burton Albion debut as the Brewers get past National League side Boreham Wood in the third round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Macclesfield make it two against FA Cup holders
item.description: Isaac Buckley-Ricketts sends Macclesfield 2-0 up against reigning FA Cup champions Crystal Palace.

item.title: England's Stanway to leave Bayern in summer
item.description: England international Georgia Stanway will leave Bayern Munich upon the expiry of her contract at the end of the season.

item.title: Bandaged Dawson puts Macclesfield ahead against Palace
item.description: Shortly after adjusting the bandages on his head after picking up an injury early in the match, Paul Dawson nods home Macclesfield's opener to put them ahead against Crystal Palace.

item.title: Frustrated Arsenal held to goalless draw against 10-player Man Utd
item.description: Frustrated Arsenal held to goalless draw against 10-player Man Utd

item.title: Wrexham shock Forest in shootout after six-goal thriller
item.description: Watch highlights as Wrexham shock Nottingham Forest in an FA Cup third-round thriller, beating the Premier League side on penalties after a 3-3 draw.

item.title: Oxford beat MK Dons in FA Cup penalty shootout
item.description: New Oxford United boss Matt Bloomfield watches on from the stands as his side beat MK Dons on penalties to progress to the FA Cup fourth round.

item.title: Top four or FA Cup? - Rogers on his Villa ambitions
item.description: Morgan Rogers shares what the FA Cup means to him and whether he would rather win the competition or finish in the Premier League top four with Aston Villa.

item.title: 'Dream big, great realities' - Maestre outlines London City ambitions
item.description: BBC Sport looks at London City Lionesses' ambitious new boss Eder Maestre and what he will bring to the Women's Super League.

item.title: 'Power, speed and ability' - why Spurs are excited by Gaupset
item.description: BBC Sport looks at Tottenham's signing of exciting 20-year-old midfielder Signe Gaupset from Norwegian top-flight side Brann.

item.title: Time-wasting by goalkeepers can harm WSL 'attractiveness'
item.description: Arsenal manager Renee Slegers says time-wasting by goalkeepers in the Women's Super League can harm the "attractiveness" of the game.

item.title: How to follow the FA Cup on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the FA Cup third round on TV and radio this weekend.

item.title: Chukwuani nears Rangers deal & Gillespie set for CEO role
item.description: Rangers are set to announce the signing of midfielder Tochi Chukwuani from Austrian club Sturm Graz before Sunday's game at Aberdeen and confirm St Mirren vice-chairman Jim Gillespie as their new chief executive early next week.

item.title: Cardiff say transfer embargo will be 'removed'
item.description: Cardiff City are under a transfer embargo for "non-submission of annual accounts", but say the situation will be resolved in the coming days.

item.title: Wrexham's story 'written in the stars, literally'
item.description: Wrexham's remarkable rise continues as they knock Premier League side Nottingham Forest out of the FA Cup in dramatic fashion.

item.title: New players, new managers - what to look out for in WSL after winter break
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the key talking points as the Women's Super League returns after a four-week winter break.

item.title: Arsenal monitoring Livramento - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Arsenal monitoring Tino Livramento as a potential summer signing, Aston Villa exploring a deal for Conor Gallagher, Dominik Szoboszlai close to agreeing contract extension at Liverpool, plus more.

item.title: 'Unacceptable to the badge' - Dyche fumes at FA Cup exit
item.description: Sean Dyche calls for some of his Nottingham Forest players to "have a look in the mirror" after an "unacceptable" first-half performance in their FA Cup loss at Wrexham on penalties.

item.title: Solskjaer set for face-to-face talks with Man Utd chiefs
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is set for face-to-face talks with Manchester United chiefs about becoming the club's interim boss.

item.title: Seven SPFL games postponed amid weather warnings
item.description: A further six of Saturday's SPFL fixtures are postponed, including Morton v Dunfermline and Queen's Park v St Johnstone in the Championship.

item.title: Villa set to sign Chelsea's Jean-Francois
item.description: Aston Villa are set to sign Chelsea and France midfielder Oriane Jean-Francois for Â£450,000.

item.title: Young Chelsea can be new Class of '92 - Rosenior
item.description: Chelsea's young squad has the potential to grow and deliver trophies like Manchester United's famous Class of '92 side, new boss Liam Rosenior believes.

item.title: 'If you're outside the top six, you can never target an FA Cup run'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why the FA Cup has fallen down the pecking order for managers, despite still being a special competition.

item.title: Can you name every FA Cup winner?
item.description: The FA Cup third round takes place this weekend - we want you to name every winner of the competition since it began in 1872.

item.title: A warrior touched by tragedy - Terry Yorath obituary
item.description: Former Wales captain and manager Terry Yorath, who has died aged 75, had a glittering career, but his life was deeply affected by two tragedies.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Relaxed' Hearts keep calm amid Old Firm noise
item.description: After a tumultuous week at Celtic and continued transfer talk at the champions and rivals Rangers, Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts appear well prepared for the second half of the season.

item.title: 'Nobody can get hold of him' - what happened to David Batty?
item.description: England midfielder David Batty vowed to have "nothing to do with the football industry" after retirement. As his former clubs Newcastle and Leeds prepare to meet, BBC Sport asks: what happened to him?

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: How much is the prize money for the men's and women's FA Cup?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain the prize money for the men and women's FA Cup this season.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: Is the new manager bounce real or a myth?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains whether the new manager bounce is real, or just a myth

item.title: Why is the Spanish Super Cup played in Saudi Arabia?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why the Spanish Super Cup is being played in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: How does Amorim's record compare to other Man Utd managers?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Ruben Amorim's record as a Manchester United manager and how it compares to other previous bosses

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: When does the January transfer window open and close?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team look at when the 2026 January transfer window opens.

item.title: Rangers make loan enquiries for Sunderland duo - gossip
item.description: Sunderland duo linked with Rangers, clubs chase Hibernian striker and foreign interest in Scotland defender.

item.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
item.description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

item.title: Tomori on Tuchel, living in Italy and why this is the best he has felt
item.description: Fikayo Tomori says his success at AC Milan shows English players "can go abroad and adapt to a different way of living".

item.title: AC Milan v Como league game in Australia cancelled
item.description: A Italian league match in Australia between AC Milan and Como will no longer take place following football sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation, says Serie A.

item.title: Who's leading the race for the Golden Shoe?
item.description: As the halfway mark of the 2025-26 campaign approaches, BBC Sport takes a look at the frontrunners for this season's European Golden Shoe award.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
